dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Ske must be your pride and joy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY BRIGGS
dialogues.text: You could sa} that. A long awkward silence as missed years pass between them.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I think I need to go, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Probably be a good idea. Danielle turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Danielle? You be a good girl now.  103.

dialogues.speaker: LATER.
dialogues.text: Peggy sits on the front stoop as Sue~Ann paces nervously. Danielle appears from the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: {sobbing) Mommy? Sue-Ann rushes to her daughter, and throws her arms aroun her.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so stupid. I'm so stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danielle sits between Peggy and her mother. She is asleep with her head-on Sue-Ann’s shoulder. INT. DANIELLE’S BEDROOM- LATER Danielle enters her room to find Mindy asleep in her bed. She stands on a chair and begins removing the collage of from her walls. Sue-ann enters.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Can I do anything for you, baby?

dialogues.speaker: . DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Bring me a trash can? EXT. CLARKE‘S HOUSE-DAY Danielle pulls up in her Mustang, gets out of the car and rings the doorbell. No answer. Peggy appears from around the side of the house, taking t trash to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gardner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I wanted to know how Clarke‘s doing. PEGGY . He's going to be fine. It’s all |. gonna be fine. You just go on...

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Is he at that school?

dialogues.speaker: . PEGGY
dialogues.text: There's so much going on here. It's the. best place for him right now.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: He must totaily hate it.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: I’ve got to figure a few things out.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I caused you any problems.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Honey, our problems started long before you.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Where's his daddy?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: He's getting himself a little apartment.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I broke up your family. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: Sometimes things need to get broken so's they can be fixed. I’m not the person I should be. We got these ideas about what being a good parent is. As long as we're doing our best that's all that matters, but it’s not true. I mean, if your best stinks, what good are you?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Clarke would rather be with you.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: All those times I let him hurt my son. I'm not what’s best.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t mean to do you no disrespect, Mam, but that’s fuckin’ stupid.

dialogues.speaker: . PEGGY
dialogues.text: You'll understand when you're older.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Will Clarke? What’s worse, growing up with a weak mama, or no mama? He loves you now, but he’s gonna hate you for this.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY
dialogues.text: This is really none of your business,

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I know what it’s like to find out you're not wanted, to find out that for your whole life, nothing's ever gonna be perfect. Seems to me though you should try to make the most of it if you love somebody. INT. MORMON TEMPLE- pay A MORMON PREACHER marries Sue~Ann and Ray. Danielle and M are the bridesmaids, Charlie is best man.

dialogues.speaker: MORMON FREACHER
dialogues.text: We stand before you in the eyes of the lord and ask that he accept this family, Sue-Ann and Ray and their children, Charlie, Mindy and Danielle, into his holy kingdom everlasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danielle stands alone before class with Joan, who looks rather beaten.  106.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I guess you could say that our little girl has been through a lot in her short life. She has learned that sometimes you gotta accept what life throws at you, but only after a really good fight to find out what you're made of. It's the fight that will make accepting bearable.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HATCHER
dialogues.text: Very nice, Danielle.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I'm not done.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HATCHER
dialogues.text: okay.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: She also misses her daddy a whole lot, and hopes that someday her family will be brought back together, because it’s fun. INT. PRINCIPAL MULRAY’S OFFICE-DAY Danielle sits as before in a chair across from Principal Mulray.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL MULRAY
dialogues.text: You’ve come a long way Danielle. What happened to that girl who would act out at the drop of the hat? Danielle shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL MULRAY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hatcher says you're doing great, that you're more involved, says you even signed up for the talent show.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I’m working at being a more traditional kind of person.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL MULRAY
dialogues.text: I might be taking a risk here, but if you promise that I can trust you, I’1l put you back with the normal kids. Can I trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF BOYS finish up their act, a rather sad break dancing routine on a square of linoleum.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL MULRAY
dialogues.text: Let’s hear it for the Mid-City Gangsters. The Audience claps, as the boys do a choreographed bow ou a “wave”.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL MULRAY
dialogues.text: And now the musical stylings of Miss Danielle Edmonston. There is mild-to-no applause. The curtain opens, revealing Danielle in spotlight behind microphone.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: This is for my baby’s Daddy. A piano intro...

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: (singing as best she can, but still rather badly) Baby cried the day the circus came to town/ Cause she didn‘t want parades just passing by her/ So she painted on a smile and she took up with some clown/ While she danced without a net upon the wire/ I know a lot about her ‘cause you see, baby is an awful lot like me/ Don’t cry out loud/ just keep it inside and learn how to hide your feelings/ Fly high and proud/ and iff you should fall/ remember you almost had it all... The door to the auditerium opens, revealing the silhouett @ mane...  108.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Baby saw that when they pulled the big top down/ They left behind her dreams among the litter... The man makes his way slowly down the aisle of the auditorium. We cannot make him out fully in the darkness, he appears to be in uniform...

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: And the different kind of love she thought she had found/ There was nothing left there but saw dust and some glitter/ But baby can't be broken, cause you see, she had the finest teacher that was me, I told her... The man begins to sing, cutting off Danielle.

dialogues.speaker: CLARKE
dialogues.text: (singing) Don’t exy out loud, just keep it inside and learn how to hide your feelings/ Fly high and proud, and if you should fall, remember you almost had it all! The spotlight finds Clarke in the aisle, dressed to the n in full military regalia, his entrance rivaling Richard Gere’s in ’An Officer and a Gentleman’. Modulation...Clarke takes the stage to Danielle's utter delight, the two finish the song as a defiant duet.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE / CLARKE
dialogues.text: Don’t Cry out loud/ Just keep it inside and learn how to hide your feelings/ Fly High and proud, And if you should fall remember you almost made it / Don’t cry out loud/ Just keep it inside and learn how to hide your feelings/ Fly High and proud and remember you almost had it all!itittt Danielle and Clarke finish with flourish. There is absolu no reaction from the audience.  109.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: They let you out for good behavior or something?

dialogues.speaker: CLARKE
dialogues.text: My mama came and got me. Said she was compelled. ~

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: It was the least I could do after I ruined your family.

dialogues.speaker: CLARKE
dialogues.text: Thank you for that.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: How's it feel to be free?

dialogues.speaker: CLARKE
dialogues.text: Actually, I kinda miss that place.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLARKE
dialogues.text: In a school with no girls, I was very popular.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: You fuckin’ whore!

dialogues.speaker: CLARKE
dialogues.text: Taught by the best.

dialogues.speaker: DANTELLE
dialogues.text: Clarke, nobody likes a dirty girl.

dialogues.speaker: CLARKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Clarke and Danielle get into the Mustang and pull away. Clarke pops his tape into the stereo and presses play. A rock downbeat. Debbie Harry begins to sing “Dreaming”. The top is down. The wind blows through their hair. In the backseat, Joan smiles. The End.
